pr_title: NCL-5497 - Store User in BuildConfiguration and BuildConfigurationAudited

timeline.message: NCL-5497 - Store User in BuildConfiguration and BuildConfigurationAudited
Add sql script to add new columns, indexes, foreign keys

timeline.bodyText: Here you are changing the creationUser of existing BC. This method creates new BC-audited for existing BC. It's called createRevision because from API point it is creating new entity, but it's actually just updating the BC.
timeline.author: janinko

replies.bodyText: ah good point, thanks for the clarification, the name tricked me, I am now going to update just the lastModificationUser
replies.author: vibe13

timeline.bodyText: Dependencies are not audited. Should we update the user even when no audited data got changed?
timeline.author: janinko

replies.bodyText: I would have done that by default, if anything got changed in the BuildConfiguration, I would have updated the lastModificationUser, even if the changes were not audited. But that would indeed cause some confusion now, as users would see a lastModificationUser changed but possibly no corresponding revision in the list...so yep, better not updating it at the moment. Thanks!
replies.author: vibe13

timeline.author: janinko

timeline.message: Do not change lastModificatioUser when changing dependencies; do not change creationUser when creating a new revision
